item.title: Western grammatical influence on vernacular Chinese in the 20th century
item.description: Note: This is an answer to a StackExchange question: https://chinese.stackexchange.com/questions/20763/western-grammatical-influence-on-vernacular-chinese-in-the-20th-century Regarding to how early writers are influenced by western languages. The renowned poet and translator 余光中 has written quite a lot about it. Below are some examples he mentioned in his articles. Deliberate plurals. Traditionally plurals are only used when absolutely necessary. In the following sentence the reader doesn’t actually care whether it’s one fly, a group of flies, or fly as a species.
